algorithm_technique: Sliding window with a frequency map to track distinct elements.
problem_summary_simple: Count distinct numbers in every subarray of a given size k.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a sliding window and a frequency map (Counter) to efficiently update distinct counts as the window moves.
key_insights: A sliding window is ideal for problems involving contiguous subarrays of fixed size.
A frequency map (like `collections.Counter`) is crucial for tracking element counts within the window.
When the window slides, decrement the count of the element leaving and increment the count of the element entering.
